newsitem.title: KENYA: Rates marginally down at Kenya T-bill auction.
newsitem.headline: Rates marginally down at Kenya T-bill auction.

text.p: Interest rates on government treasury bills were down marginally at the Central Bank of Kenya's weekly auction on Thursday, the bank said on Friday.
The bank said it offered 9.0 billion shillings of treasury bills which was under-subscribed by 99.65 million shillings. But it accepted only 321.95 million shillings of bills.

There were 14 bids for 28-day bills of which two were successful, three were unsuccessful and nine were non-competitive. There were 298 bids for 91-day bills with 15 successful, 209 unsuccessful and 74 non-competitive.
The bank said that it offered an average interest rate of 23.424 percent percent for its main category of 91-day treasury bills compared to 24.090 in the previous week.
It offered 15.005 percent on 28-day bills compared to 15.049 percent previously. The bank offered 20.070 percent rates on the rarely sold 182-day category of treasury bills.
Of the amounts tendered, 30.30 million was for 28-day bills and 8.869 billion for 91-day bills, the bank added.
It was the first time in more than a year that the bank had accepted around one-third of what it had tendered and a senior official said that reflected its fight on interest rates.

"What we accepted reflects our fight against rising interest rates," said Reuben Marambii, chief banking manager at the Central Bank of Kenya. "The (central) bank is determined to keep interest rates down."
Marambii said bids that came in had asked for interest rates of as high as 30 percent, which was "ridiculous".
"Everyone is bidding high. We can't keep following that trend because that would keep swelling the speculative spirit."
"What we wanted was to keep interest rates roughly where they were last week and we got very few bids there," he said.
The bank does not normally indicate whether it was foreign or domestic investors that bid for the treasury bills.
The bank invited tenders for another 7.0 billion shillings of treasury bills to be submitted by Thursday next week.
